moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7
comment: preparing to meet e4-e5 with ...Bc8-b7, protecting Ra8 and threatening Qg3

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6
comment: This forces ...Nf6-e8 which removes pressure from Pe4.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2
comment: probably heading to h5

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6
comment: This defends Pg7 and is well positioned to threaten White's queen-side, but it leaves Ne8 very awkward. White shouldn't try to force things now. Aiming to trade bishops and play against the weakened Pd6 might be effective.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3
comment: questionable, but not easily proven

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6
comment: Karjakin goes with the tried-and-true answer, develop pieces to fight with.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5
comment: preventing Ne2-f5, but opening the b3-g8 diagonal; whom does this favor most?

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5 16. Bg5
comment: preparing Nf3-h4-f5

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5 16. Bg5 Be6 17. Qh4
comment: preparing Ne2-g3-h5

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5 16. Bg5 Be6 17. Qh4 h6 18. Bxf6 Nxf6 19. Ng3
comment: Black is developed and his king is safe, but now he has to continue fighting White's immediate plan. A nice looking position doesn't win the day, a good plan and a good move is important.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5 16. Bg5 Be6 17. Qh4 h6 18. Bxf6 Nxf6 19. Ng3 Bg4
comment: This is bad because Nf3 isn't the main threat, Bb3 or Ng3 is much more dangerous.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5 16. Bg5 Be6 17. Qh4 h6 18. Bxf6 Nxf6 19. Ng3 Bg4 20. Nf5 Bxf5 21. exf5 Na5 22. Bd5 Rad8 23. Rfe1 Rfe8 24. h3 Nc6
comment: Black threatens ...Nc6-e7xf5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bc4 e6 7. Bb3 b5 8. O-O Be7 9. Qf3 Qc7 10. Qg3 O-O 11. Bh6 Ne8 12. Rad1 Bd7 13. Nce2 Bf6 14. Nf3 Nc6 15. c3 e5 16. Bg5 Be6 17. Qh4 h6 18. comment: White's threats to Pd5 and Pa4 is all that prevents Black from forcing a clear advantage. But, how can Black ever hope to get away from those threats?

Rd3 Kf8 34. Qd2 Red7 35. Qe3 f6 36. R3d2 Qb7 37. Qc5+ Kf7 38. a4 bxa4 39. Qxa5 Qc6 40. Qb4 Rb7 41. Qg4 Kf8 42. Qf3 Rbd7 43. Ra1 Qc4 44. Rad1 d4 45. Qe4 a3 46. bxa3 Qxc3
comment: Pa3 is weak and in any simplified ending Black's central pawns would naturally dominate. White needs to use f2-f4xe5 to weaken Black's pawns and king.
